item.title: Serve React applicaiton with Nginx in k8s
item.description: A few things I’ve learned after deploying React application + nginx in Kubernetes. nobody user To run a process as non-root you don’t need create a user in your docker image. Just use the nobody: docker run --user="nobody" nginx read-only container To succesfully run a read only container with nginx don’t forget to pass some volumes: docker run --read-only --tmpfs "/var/cache/nginx" --tmpfs "/run" --rm nginx-react-app In k8s add volumes and use them as the container’s volumeMounts.

item.title: Dockerizing a Workspaced Node.js Application
item.description: Re-usage of build cache is one of the most important things in Docker images creating.
